posts.title: [POST OFICIAL] JAPONESADAS
posts.content:
hace 24 minutos, yagami_kaede dijo:

Ayer acabÃ© la partida que tenÃ­a en marcha a Lunar SIlver Star Story en su version de PSone. Segunda vez que acabo el juego, pero han pasado unos 20 aÃ±os mas o menos desde que lo hice por primera vez. No es un juego de larga duraciÃ³n, la partida me ha llevado 30 horas pero podÃ­a haberla acabado en 25-26 si no me hubiera demorado con alguna cosa.

Un jrpg muy agradable de jugar, muy aÃ±ejo (su primera versiÃ³n es de 1992), que no para deÂ  hacerte guiÃ±os desde un principio sobre la gran aventura que estas a punto de empezar, que gira sobre una temÃ¡tica que suele estar presente en muchos jrpgs que es el amor. Amor bastante inocente. La linea del bien y el mal trazada ,aunque con algun claro oscuro.

En cuanto al sistema de combate por turnos, es uno de estos juegos en el que los personajes cuando atacan permanecen en el lugar al que se han desplazado (excepto con algunos skills que los "devuelven" a su posicion original de un salto), esto permite ciertas estrategias aunque no vas a a tardar mucho en darte cuenta de que la mayor parte de los combates los vas a resolver igual porque es lo que mas compensa (como ya comentabamos unas respuestas atras a tenor de la saga Wild Arms ). Con los boss vas a entrar en una guerra de desgaste pero vas hacer mas o menos lo de siempre. Y cuando no lo haces es porque para ese combate no tengas a todo tu grupo principal y tengas que alternar el papel en los combatesÂ de algun personaje.

Podemos decir que a lo largo de la aventura principal el juego penaliza un tanto que subas de nivel. Los atributos de los boss del juego se adaptan (mas bien, son multiplicados) por el nivel al que llevas a Alex, el protagonista. Aunque si que puedes hacer una cosa y es hacer que tus compaÃ±eros suban mÃ¡s de nivel que Alex, porque los personajes pueden huir de los combates uno a uno o en grupo. Ese reajuste que afecta a los boss del juego es asÃ­ hasta que alcanzas el nivel 50, a partir de ahÃ­ parece ser que no se aplica . Pero no es un juego pensado para alcanzar el nivel 99. Es un juego que vas a terminar de forma natural rondando el nivel 45-47, subir de nivel mÃ¡s alla del nivel 50 exige dedicar un tiempo que no merece la pena.

Si veis en un gameplay a alguien pasandose el final boss con nivel superior a 60, o ha usado algun codigo para hacerlo, o ha dedicado cerca de 10 horas a subir de nivel en la mazmorra final.

Y hoy seguramente empiezo partida a la secuela, Lunar Eternal Blue Complete. Que a ese juego si que no tuve la ocasion de jugarlo en su momento y se dicen cosas muy buenas de Ã©l.

Yo ese juego me lo juguÃ© en su versiÃ³n de GBA: Lunar Legend. Bastante buen juego (aunque la calidad de sonido pudo haber estado mejor en esa versiÃ³n de lo que saliÃ³).

Â 

El Lunar 2 no lo he jugado nunca.

posts.content:
Episode 77: A Powerful Enemy, Garagas Fierce Assault!!


Determined to get their hands on the Gekirin via whatever means necessary, Boruto teams up with the others to try and corner Garaga. But Garagas ability to accurately detect the location of his opponents and the ability to change them into stone forces Boruto into a hard battle. Amidst the battle, Boruto and his friends recall a strangeness in Garagas movement and form a strategy according to that, and are finally able to corner Garaga. Then, Boruto raises a certain proposal to Garaga.

Episode 78: Each and Every Expectation

Mitsuki is taken by Hidden Stone Ninjas, Kokuy, Sekiei and others. Yokuy* (Kokuy) and the others are heading towards their home country, the Land of Earth. On the other side, after receiving the information from the White Snake Sage using his power that Mitsuki is headed towards the Land of Earth, Boruto and his group are also advancing towards the Land of Earth.


*TL Note:  The RAW has  (Yokuyou) instead of  (Kokuyou). This is likely a typo error. 

Episode 79: Meeting Again, Mitsuki!!

Standing in the way of Boruto and his group who are chasing Mitsuki is Kokuy. Kokuy possesses enough strength to be able to defeat the Jnin that the Village of the Hidden Leaf would task with searching for Mitsuki, and dominates Boruto and the others. With the appearance of a helper, they somehow are able to repel Kokuy, and can finally have their desired reunion with Mitsuki, but!?

Episode 80: Mitsukis Friends

Mitsuki refuses to return to the village with Boruto and the others, and instead wish to continue on with Kokuys group. During this, Sekieis become more ill, and his condition also worsens. In order to help the suffering Sekiei, Kokuy heads in the direction of their comrades, and during this time Sekiei says to Mitsuki I want you to teach me about humans. Around this time, Kurotsuchi, the Fourth Tsuchikage, is looking after her grandfather, noki, whos health is in shambles, when she is attacked by a group of unidentified people.

Rock Lee es un Shinobi de Konohagakure. Inmediatamente se convirtiÃ³ en un favorito de los fanÃ¡ticos desde el arco de Chnin Exams. Estoy seguro de que todos ustedes lo han visto y sintieron Hey!! Una vez mÃ¡s, estuvo involucrado en la misiÃ³n de recuperaciÃ³n de Sasuke, donde se enfrentÃ³ a uno de los miembros de los Sound Five, Kimimaro.

Pero, sorprendentemente, Lee no era parte de Naruto Shippuden en absoluto. Esta fue una decisiÃ³n realmente extraÃ±a tomada por Masashi Kishimoto. Toda la acciÃ³n que pudimos ver de Lee fue de la 4Âª Gran Guerra Ninja. Donde casi todos consiguieron algo de tiempo de grabaciÃ³n de todos modos. Entonces, Â¿por quÃ© exactamente sucediÃ³ esto?

Bueno, antes que nada, Kishimoto nunca pensÃ³ en Rock Lee como un personaje importante. Toda la publicidad y la atenciÃ³n que Rock Lee recibiÃ³ durante los exÃ¡menes de Chnin sorprendieron a Masashi Kishimoto tambiÃ©n.

Eso no quiere decir que no considerara escribirlo mÃ¡s o crear mÃ¡s historias sobre Ã©l. Pero el momento nunca fue el correcto, asÃ­ que nunca tuve la oportunidad.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

 

Episode 37: A Shinobis Resolution

Boruto was the first to challenge the graduation exams proctor Kakashi, after being the first to arrive at his location, however, he is easily held down. Furthermore, Kakashi criticized not only Boruto himself, but also all his classmates, leading Boruto to become extremely frustrated. Borutos classmates arrive, and manage to free Boruto through a combined effort, allowing him to escape from Kakashi. Boruto is uncharacteristically depressed, so his classmates do their best to restore his spirits. Finding himself again, Boruto proposes a strategy to everyone.

Episode 38: Formation, Three Man Cells?

Boruto and his friends are successful in becoming apprentice ninja, Genin, their first step. Firstly, they must form their basic teams to carry out missions in, a three man cell. Boruto expected to group up with his close friend Shikadai; however, Shikadai is forming a cell with Inojin and Chocho, following in their parents footsteps of the Inoshikacho trio. Boruto then becomes grouped with Sarada and Mitsuki.

Episode 39: The Path Illuminated by the Full Moon

Mitsuki was originally from another village, the Village of the Hidden Sound. But since meeting with Boruto and the others, Mitsuki has decided that he will now remain at the Village of the Hidden Leaf and become a ninja. In the past, Mitsuki has had his memory taken away from him, and had lost his identity, along with what he wants to achieve in life, only to awaken in an unfamiliar laboratory. The mystery that surrounds Mitsuki, and the plethora of thoughts that surround him, has now cleared up for him.
 

Boruto anime will be on a break on the 3rd of January 2018.

posts.content:
Por fin en el capÃ­tulo 36 comenzarÃ¡n los examenes para que Boruto y los demÃ¡s se conviertan en Gennins:


 


Episode 33: Slump!! Super Beast Imitating Drawing
From Inojin Yamanakas love of drawing since a young age, his signature technique, Super Beast Imitating Drawing, breathes life into pictures. However, one day he suddenly became unable to use that technique. The confused Inojin sought out his father, Sai, who uses the same technique, but Sai would not give him any advice. For some reason, Sai then recommends Inojin participate in a drawing competition aimed at children.

Episode 34: The Night of Falling Stars
In attempt to catch the mysterious fish Eiengoi, which is said to be so tasty if you eat it once, you will never forget its deliciousness, Boruto goes on a camping trip with his classmates. As this is likely to be the last event with his classmates before graduation, in an effort to create an everlasting memory, Boruto is determined to catch Eiengoi no matter what it takes.

Episode 35: The Tripartite Meeting!!
Before the graduation examinations, it has been decided that in order to confirm the students graduation options, there will be tripartite meetings for that effect. However, Boruto, who performs admirably in Ninja Techiniques, notices that he had never worked hard in class, and has made no commitment in becoming a ninja. Boruto then meets Sukea, a freelance journalist who is interviewing Academy students who are about to graduate. Sukea notices a certain dangerousness in Borutos carefree and comfortable perspective on what it means to be a ninja, and decides to give some advice to him.

Episode 36: Graduation Examinations, Begin!!
Examinations, Begin!! At last, the graduation exams have begun. After the first theory exam has finished, Boruto and his friends challenge the practical abilities exam. The exam involves a Bell Taking Test, with the 6th Hokage, Kakashi Hatake, and the Academys other teachers as opponents.

posts.content:
Sonys Japan Studio Thinking of Starting Development on Several New Titles


Studio Japan's Senior Vice President Allan Becker confirmed that they're looking into starting up development on several new titles.




Sony Interactive Entertainments very own Japan Studio may arguably have the most unique lineup of games when compared to other first party studios owned by the company.





 


The developer has set themselves apart from other Sony-owned first party studios by creating games that are much more obscure when compared to the likes of Uncharted, Horizon, God of War, or Infamous. If youre unfamiliar with Japan Studio some of their titles include Shadow of the Colossus, Ape Escape, Bloodborne, Freedom Wars, Knack, Gravity Rush, and many more.


In an interview with IGN Japan Studios Senior Vice President Allan Becker said:



Without having to state too much more, with Gravity Rush 2 finishing up and The Last Guardian finishing up, we reached this big milestone within Japan Studio, and so finally we feel like were free to do new things. Were going to finish up Knack 2 as well, so, as for the internal team, theyre much more freed up, so we are thinking about starting up several new titles.



Sony Interactive Entertainment Worldwide Studios President Shuhei Yoshida also added that he likes to see equal effort on continuing on popular IP and creating new ones.


Japan Studios latest title, Knack 2, is coming exclusively to PS4 later this year on September 5.



 


Fuente Dualshockers

The Seven Deadly Sins Western Release Announced as PS4 Exclusive; Gets First Trailer and Screenshots

 

Bandai Namco announced the western release of the anime-inspired The Seven Deadly Sins: Knights of Britannia, exclusively for PS4.

 

Today Bandai Namco Entertainment announced that the recently-revealed action-adventure The Seven Deadly Sins: Knights of Britannia, will come west in early 2018.

Unlike Little Witch Academia: Chamber of Time, that was announced earlier today, The Seven Deadly Sins has been explicitly revealed as a PS4 exclusive, retaining the same platform as its Japanese version.


Assemble the Seven Deadly Sins and fight to save the Kingdom of Liones in The Seven Deadly Sins: Knights of Britannia, coming to PS4!

Based on the hit manga, The Seven Deadly Sins by Nabaka Suzuki, enjoy stories of adventure and experience all of the action and excitement from the anime. Play through memorable fights with famous characters such as Meliodas, Elizabeth, Hawk, and others in all of their unique fighting styles.

  • Assemble the Seven Deadly Sins -The popular hit anime The Seven Deadly Sins comes to console for the very first

    time.

     

  • Action Oriented  A high-tension and fast-paced action fighting style that is expected of the popular anime series.

     

  • Lush Environments  The world of Britannia comes to life in a scenic 3D environment, made possible by the power of

    the PS4.

     

  • Adventurous Storyline  Experience an enticing story line and plenty of places in Britannia to explore.



The game is based on the popular manga by Nakaba Suzuki, that debuted in 2012 in Japan and is still ongoing. Its growing popularity led to the airing of two consecutive TV series in 2015 and 2016.

The game supports one player offline and two online, and will come with subtitles in English, French, Italian, Spanish and German. The press release appears to indicate that voices will be only in Japanese.

Alongside the announcement,  Bandai Namco Entertainment also released the very first trailer of the game, and the first batch of screenshots, that you can enjoy below and in the gallery at the bottom of the post.

 

 

 













 


 

Fuente Dualshockers

Atelier Liddy and Soeur: Alchemists of the Mysterious Painting announced

 


 


Koei Tecmo and Gust have announced Atelier Liddy and Soeur: Alchemists of the Mysterious Painting.


The game features character design by Yuugen and Noco. Above are silhouettes of the two main characters, Liddy and Soeur.


While the game is part of the Mysterious series of Atelier games, it was said that it is being made differently from the past two titles (Atelier Sophie and Atelier Firis).


Further information was not announced.


(Editors Note: Gust has not revealed the official romanizations for the character names Liddy and Soeur. Our own guesses are all we have for now.)

Sistema de skils de DQXI, copio de neogaf:

Â 

Â 

The latest issue of Weekly Jump reveals a new Skill Panel system for Dragon Quest XI: In Search of Departed Time.

Â 

Â 

The Skill Panel is a new system by which the characters of Dragon Quest XI can grow. The Skill Panel is lined up with unique skills for each character. By using Skill Points, which are acquired through methods such as leveling up, and unlocking panels, you can learn new skills. Youll start from the middle of the Skill Panel and can use skill points to learn the skills of unlocked panels. The shape of the Skill Panel is different for each character.

Â 

Â 

Heres an example of some of the unique skills you can learn using the Skill Panel:

Â 

Â 

Protagonist: Giga Slash Mow down the enemy using a lightning blade in a skill exclusive to a hero.

Â 

Camus: Steal Get items from monsters.

Â 

Veronica: Magical Awakening Increases the power of spells.

Â 

Senya: Melody of Fire Puts on a flame of protection.

Â 

Silvia: Flute of Fascination Charms monsters with the sound of a flute.

Â 

Martina: Vacuum Kick Hits the enemy with a powerful kick.

Â 

Row: Aesthetic Enlightenment Attains enlightenment and increases spell effects.

Another new system will be introduced in the issue of Weekly Jump that follows this one

Â

Switch recibirÃ¡ mucho apoyo por parte de XSeed, pronto se harÃ¡n anuncios

XSEED often tends to support Nintendo platforms. Even when the Wii U was winding down, the publisher brought Shantae: Half-Genie Hero and Exiles End to Wii U by working with WayForward and Magnetic Realms respectively.

With Switch, XSEED once again has plans to support a Nintendo system. A representative from the company told one fan that announcements will be made soon. Although, mysteriously, it may not specifically be for the titles and series youre looking for.

XSEED said:

 


Cita:We are big supporters of the Switch so youll definitely be seeing some announcements about it from us soon, though it may not specifically be for the titles and series youre looking for.

Atlus abre una web relacionada con Radiant Historia (el pastel se revelarÃ¡ en la Famitsu del 23 de Marzo)


 


Atlus has just gone live with a teaser site for what looks to be a new Radiant Historia game. Access it here.

Obviously the URL is pointing to the site being related to Radiant Historia. Other than that, a message reads: In the near future, a history once told will unfold again. And an unknown path will come to be known. More information will be shared in this weeks Famitsu.

Ni No Kuni II's development is 45% complete, new details on Kingdom building:


 



Ni no Kuni II Details On Kingdom Building And A Teaser About A Major New System

 



 


Level-5 CEO Akihiro Hino recently got together with Famitsu to share the latest on his companys new RPG, Ni no Kuni II, in an interview for the magazine. [Thanks, Hachima.]


 


Heres a key highlight from the interview:


 


Kingdom Building in Ni no Kuni II is definitely a major subject, but could you tell us about any new systems in terms of game play?


Akihiro Hino, CEO: A new system that is precisely for the kingdom building will appear. That said, youre not going to actually build kingdoms yourself, but its a system that revolves around placing staff [to construct]. Players will get to decide on what kind of kingdoms theyll make, so theyll get to enjoy having their own kingdoms that are different from other players.


 


Again this is a different element from the kingdom building, but the field maps are being drawn in diorama-like fashion, and theres a very big secret to it that involves one other major new system.


 


I cant say more about it, but this single syste alone is enough to make you want to make a game around it, and its a highly anticipated system for us.


 


What about the Japanese language cast?


Hino: I cant share any hints now, but we plan to bring in super luxurious talent for it.


 


Its also noted that Ni no Kuni IIs development is currently at 45% complete.


 


Ni no Kuni II is expected to release in 2017 for PlayStation 4 and PC.


 


Fuente Siliconera

Quedan pocos dÃ­as para que termine el kickstarter de Legrand Legacy.


 


 

***Kickstarter Updates, Most Promising Game Award, and Thunderclap *** 

 

Hi guys,

It was an amazingly eventful week for the Legrand Legacy team. Between running our Kickstarter campaign and attending Game Prime (note: we WON!), weve got our hands full! Here are some highlights from the past week.

 

First of all, Legrand Legacy is over 60% funded on Kickstarter! Were so excited and amazed by the support of the community, and are very thankful for all the backers who have joined us on this journey. We still have 8 days left and more than 30% to go, so we still need your help! Please back us on Kickstarter and share the news with all of your friends so that we can reach our goal before time runs out.

 

 

 

Next, Legrand Legacy won the Most Promising Game award in Game Prime 2016. Game Prime 2016 is the 8th annual Indonesia game developer conference, whose mission is to gather the industry's greatest minds in one venue to foster collaboration and innovation. Game Prime 2016 invited more than 100 Indonesian game studios and attracted more than 2000 attendees. We are so humbled to be selected for the Most Promising Game award this year.

 

 

Lastly, while we still have 8 days left on our Kickstarter, wed love it if you can join us in spreading the word during the last 48 hours of our campaign. Please show your support by signing up for our Thunderclap.

 

 

Once again, thank you so much for your support thus far! See you next week.

posts.content:
Shinji Hashimoto habla sobre el futuro de la saga Final Fantasy


 


El productor y gestor de la marca Final Fantasy Shinji Hashimoto ha hablado sobre el futuro de la saga, ademÃ¡s del prÃ³ximo Kingdom Hearts HD II.8 Final Chapter Prologue, durante Lucca Comics & Games 2016.

Final Fantasy XII: The Zodiac Age

La fecha de lanzamiento todavÃ­a no estÃ¡ decidida, pero desean que sea lo mÃ¡s pronto posible para coincidir con el 10Âº aniversario del juego.

Kingdom Hearts HD II.8 Final Chapter Prologue

No habrÃ¡ un 2.9. Sobre el nuevo contenido Kingdom Hearts 0.2: Birth by Sleep A Fragmentary Passage su duraciÃ³n dependerÃ¡ de cÃ³mo juguemos, pero no serÃ¡ corto.

Final Fantasy VII Remake

Square Enix trabaja en el juego y todavÃ­a habrÃ¡ que esperar un poco. Hay un rumor sobre el lanzamiento en 2017, pero la compaÃ±Ã­a no ha anunciado nada.

Final Fantasy X-3

Final Fantasy X | X-2 HD Remaster ha vendido bien y muchos jugadores esperan Final Fantasy X-3 con la historia del "audio drama" incluido como bonus. Actualmente no hay planes para desarrollar el juego, con Kitase y Nomura trabajando en Final Fantasy VII Remake y Kingdom Hearts III. Primero se concentrarÃ¡n en los juegos anunciados.

Final Fantasy XIII

Se lanzaron tres juegos de la serie XIII y Hashimoto cree que lograron diferentes resultados. "Lightning es muy popular incluso ahora, pensaremos cÃ³mo llevarla al futuro".

Final Fantasy XVI

"Es cierto que Final Fantasy XV tiene una estÃ©tica moderna, pero dado que valoramos cada entrega numerada desde cero, no sabemos si ese serÃ¡ el caso del prÃ³ximo juego. A veces la direcciÃ³n cambia segÃºn la opiniÃ³n del director, como cuando pasamos de Final Fantasy VIII a IX. No tiene que ser siempre un action RPG".

posts.title: [POST OFICIAL] JAPONESADAS
posts.content:
MÃ¡s detalles del RPG Maker Fes de 3DS:


 


RPG Maker Fes launches November 24 in Japan



 



Free "Maker Player" app to be released with the game.


RPG Maker Fes will launch for 3DS in Japan on November 24, the games newly listed Amazon Japan product page reveals. (Update: The official website has opened, further confirming the release date.)


 


image: http://gematsu.com/w...8-25-16_001.jpg


 


Additionally, a new Famitsu preview provides further details, including information about a free Nintendo eShop app, called Maker Player, that will let players who dont own RPG Maker Fes play the RPGs you create.


Get the details below.



Distribute Your Games


This titles greatest feature is that you can distribute the games you create to other 3DS owners. Even if you dont own RPG Maker Fes, you can download the free Maker Player via the Nintendo eShop, which will allow you to play user-created RPG Maker Fes games.


 


image: http://gematsu.com/w...8-25-16_002.jpg


 


 


image: http://gematsu.com/w...8-25-16_003.jpg


 


Create Maps with an Abundance of Presets


Time and patience is necessary when creating maps, but since an abundance of preset materials are being prepared, youll be able to make things with a simple touch. By using these preset parts, you can create detailed designs like original buildings.


 


image: http://gematsu.com/w...8-25-16_004.jpg


 


 


image: http://gematsu.com/w...8-25-16_005.jpg


 


 


image: http://gematsu.com/w...8-25-16_006.jpg


 


 


image: http://gematsu.com/w...8-25-16_007.jpg


 


 


image: http://gematsu.com/w...8-25-16_008.jpg


 


 


image: http://gematsu.com/w...8-25-16_009.jpg


 


 


image: http://gematsu.com/w...8-25-16_010.jpg


 


Easily Create Story Events


Essential RPG elements, like enemies, maps, and events, can be easily created with a significantly evolved interface. You can immediately check an event after you create it, allowing you to move forwrd without stress.


 


image: http://gematsu.com/w...8-25-16_011.jpg


 


 


image: http://gematsu.com/w...8-25-16_012.jpg

posts.content:
He jugado un par de horas al Star Ocean y puedo dar unas impresiones breves sobre Ã©l:

Â 

-Gran diseÃ±o artÃ­stico, aunque no tanto tÃ©cnico (popping y animaciones faciales patÃ©ticas, aunque FPS estables).

-Escenarios muy bien diseÃ±ados (Tri-Ace, obviamente) con varias rutas.

-El sistema de combate se basa en un mecanismo piedra-papel-tijera. Tiene 3 acciones: golpes dÃ©biles (X), golpes fuertes (O) y guardias (cuadrado). Los dÃ©biles pueden romper los fuertes, los fuertes las guardias, y las guardias evitan los dÃ©biles. Cada vez que "vences" un duelo de estos, recibes un bonus a tu ataque y rellenas una barra especial de varios segmentos, pero si fallas, esta se reduce.

-A su vez hay dos tipos de golpes dÃ©biles y fuertes. Si solo pulsas repetidamente el botÃ³n, haces ataques flojos, pero si lo mantienes, activas una "arte". Puedes configurarlas en los 2 botones y a 2 distancias del enemigo, cerca y lejos, aunque al principio hay muy pocas.

-La barra especial permite ejecutar ataques muy tochos, a lo Mystic Artes de los Tales, con R2+X. Cuanto mÃ¡s barra gastes, mÃ¡s fuertes son (fundamentalmente yo los reservaba para jefes).

-La mejora de los personajes se hace a partir Â de SP. Con ello puedes subir el nivel de tus habilidades o enseÃ±arles roles.

-Estos roles yo los veo como un equivalente a los tÃ­tulos de los Tales of. Puedes equipar hasta 4 a la vez, y estos otorgan ventajas. Por ejemplo, mÃ¡s daÃ±o contra enemigos tipo planta, y suben de nivel al atacar y vencer a estos enemigos.

-La mejora de habilidades se hace con unos libros, asÃ­ como su aprendizaje. Parecen comunes a todos los personajes.

-Hay tambiÃ©n talentos pasivos, como recolecciÃ³n, pesca, minerÃ­a...que te permiten recoger objetos de ciertos puntos del mapeado.

-Luego, tambiÃ©n hay un sistema de crafting de 3 tipos: alquimia, cocina y herrerÃ­a, donde invertes esos objetos recolectados asÃ­ como otros comprados u obtenidos de los enemigos.

-Hay un sistema de quests, o te las dan NPCs, o las coges de un tablÃ³n de misiones en las ciudades. Debes entregarlas donde las recibes.

-TambiÃ©n hay unos puntos con "silbatos" donde puedes activar skits donde relacionarte mÃ¡s con los personajes de tu grupo y conocerlos mejor.

-Hay cutscenes clÃ¡sicas, y la mayorÃ­a tienen lugar en tiempo real. Los combates tambiÃ©n son en el mismo escenario donde te mueves, lo cual puede hacer que si pillas un pilar de por medio te veas negro para esquivarlo y golpear (como pasa en Zestiria).

-Por ahora apenas hay dificultad, pero acabo de empezar y puede mejorar.

Â 

En general mi primera impresiÃ³n es positiva, aunque el sistema de combate debe cobrar mÃ¡s complejidad y hay opciones que aun no he desbloqueado. Da la sensaciÃ³n de que para afrontar los retos mÃ¡s difÃ­ciles requiere saber jugar y montar estrategias mejor que en los Tales of, y tiene un completo sistema de crafting y de desarrollo de personajes, por lo que tiene, a priori, contenido para dar horas a quien las busque (aunque me consta que hay poco postgame y cosas como mazmorras extra y asÃ­, pero puede compensarse con lograr el 100% de recetas, 100% de quests y asÃ­).

Â 

No sÃ© como es comparado con SO4 porque no lo juguÃ©, pero comparado con Zestiria, que es lo mÃ¡s parecido que he jugado Ãºltimamente, es como 3 veces mejor en solo 2 horas.

Â 

Â¿QuÃ© te ha parecido la OST?

posts.title: [POST OFICIAL] JAPONESADAS
posts.content:
Â 
Â 
Â 
MÃ¡s comentarios de gente que lo jugÃ³ en GAF:
Â 

I'm about 12~ish hours in (although I'm not sure there is an actual timer anywhere).Â 

Â 
+This is a good, turn-based Square RPG in the year 2016
+Story has had some touching moments so far, soundtrack really seems to help that
+Yep, piano soundtrack is pretty amazing
+Setsuna system is fun, always liked timed button presses in my turn-based RPGs
+There have been some good boss battles so far, one was particularly difficult (in a good way)
+Character-specific skills are good, tons of skills in the game, some are pretty cool
+Throwbacks to older games are fun, they don't beat you over the head with them
Â 
-(?)Hope you like snow
-Regular battles are easy
-Progress can feel a bit on the slow side at times, but I wouldn't call it boring
-Shouka system is too random and sorta confusing, Singularity system is completely random
Â 
Will definitely finish and can't wait for more RPGs from Tokyo RPG Factory.
Â 

I'm a bit further now, maybe halfway done with the game or a little more than that and I gotta say... Im really enjoying my time with it.Â 

Â 
The biggest complaint I have is that there hasn't been any side quests/events that I've found yet. There are chests you need a key to open so getting those probably after I get the airship is one side thing I can look forward to. Also these areas that seemingly have nothing in them I'm sure will be a side thing for late game.
Â 
I'm liking how simple and easy to follow the story is and am pleasantly surprised by some of the more touching moments. The piano music adds a lot to those moments. There was even a cool plot twist I didn't see coming but I really liked.Â 
Â 
It feels like a snes rpg. I'm enjoying it but I think of it more as a really really solid indie rpg with square Enix sensibilities rather than an okay true square Enix game... That should put it a little into perspective for people because both are valid ways to look at the game
Â 
I agree with everything twentytwo22 said!
Â 
Â 

Just hit end-game (I'm assuming).Â 

Â 
The structure is similar to Chrono Trigger in that there isn't much side-stuff until the end of the game. I can't speak for how much Setsuna has, but it already seems to be a decent amount (I've already found a side dungeon, a side village, and there are sealed chests all over the world to go and open).Â 
Â 
One nice thing is that there is an NPC who gives you the option to match all of the enemy levels to yours, so you can continue leveling up while re-exploring the world looking for chests and stuff.
Â 
Â 

Some more impressions on the Vita version :

Â 
-It looks gorgeous on the oled screen
-some technical issues indeed : loading times (not as bas as expected) and some "frame skips" during combats. It's a shame since it gives the game a "cheaper" feel sometimes.
-I love how it is a tribute to older jrpg with lots of little nods but is also its own thing with the strong, unified choices made (piano, snow etc)
-It's such a treat to have Crono Trigger ATB back !
-It actually reminds me of Child of Light in a way : shorter rpg (well, based on other poster impressions) with a strong personnality and a strong art and music direction. Not AAA but you can feel a lot of care was put into it. Also the fact you have a great and familiar battle system back at last (Grandia for CoL and CT for Setsuna)
Â 
Overall, right now, I'm really glad this game exists.
Â 
Â 

I just beat the game. Overall I really liked the game. I have to say I went into the game expecting a Bravely Default with a Chrono Trigger flavor, but the game is not that. The best comparison I can make is Child of Light (which i also really liked). It is like a Chrono flavored Child of Light. I think 40$ is too much for this game, 30$ is okay, and 20$ is a really good price. Not sure what It'll cost in the west...Â 

Â 
It did feel like an old school RPG, and traveling around the continents and finally getting the airship and flying around to everywhere was satisfying! I loved seeing all the places I visited and all the random newly accessible areas. The side content is all in the end game but its very much like old school RPGs in how you perform them. Talking to NPCs, hearing about random things, trying to figure out where to find what they are talking about, etc. Even has an optional "this boss is too hard, git gud" boss which i don't plan to beat..
Â 
The story is fine but nothing stand out... Simple story with a simple ending. The music makes the story nice to see fold out but the writing is shallow so its hard to get too involved in it. Setsuna is charming but none of the other characters mattered much to me.Â 
Â 
Watching the credits made me realize how few people worked on this game! I'm glad i played it though and that it wasn't artificially long. The game's progression was good. I can't wait to see what Tokyo RPG Factory do as a follow up. I think the game sold 60k in its first week physically so i suspect with the western release the game will be very profitable.
Â 
Â 

Finished it over the weekend. All in all, I'm really happy with it.Â 

+Much like CT, quests are all at the end which flesh out the characters a bit more.Â 
+Pretty simple and enjoyable story.Â 
+ATB with Link attacks was a joy, feels there are many more combinations than CT but not enough strong foes to use them on...
+The piano! I was afraid I will grow tired of it but there is so much variety.Â 
Â 
-I wish more characters than the main party would have 'face art'
-I hated the menu. Equipping stones end game was a chore as the list was mile long. And then if you rearranged the stones the order in the battle menu would alter too.Â 
-I wish the was a 'exit the dungeon' spell.Â 
Â 
Its seems to be selling well, hope the west embraces it well too. Now the question is... will we see a remake of Chrono Trigger made in a such a fashion? ;D
Â

El nÃºmero de esta semana de la revista Jump nos deja breves nuevos detalles sobre Dragon Ball: Project Fusion.
 
El juego permitirÃ¡ al jugador crearse su propio personaje, aunque de momento se desconoce si tendrÃ¡ el nivel de personalizaciÃ³n que se pudo disfrutar en el Dragon Ball Xenoverse. La revista menciona que el jugador irÃ¡ encontrÃ¡ndose con los personajes legendarios de la franquicia.
 
TambiÃ©n se presenta un nuevo personaje llamado Pinijji del cual de momento no sabemos quiÃ©n es ni cuÃ¡l es su relevancia.
 
Fuente: Blog is War
 
 
Y detalles en inglÃ©s de Project Setsuna (PS4/PSV):
 

Gems/Character Customization:
 
In addition to weapons and armor, there are also items known as Gems that you can equip to learn new command techniques or obtain additional effects.
 
There are a variety of Gems, which can be attached or detached at any time. The number of Gems you can equip at the same time increases each time you level up.
 
Gems can be acquired through the shop. You can bring the various materials you get as battle spoils to the shop, and if you have the required amount of materials, you can exchange it for a Gem. The materials required for each Gem varies.
 
Types of Gems
Wall A Gem that teaches you magic that reduces damage received from the enemy. By pressing the button at the proper timing, its effect is raised, and if you use the Setsuna System, it extends to the entire party, as well.
Provoke Provokes the enemy so that you may take all their attacks. When used with the Setsuna System, it has an added effect of damage reduction.
Firebit The fire attribute attack power of the equipped character is increased.
Stonebit Petrifies the enemy at the time of an attack.
Caloric Posseses the ability to widen the range of various attacks, and unleashes single attacks as multiple attacks.
Harvest Recovers some HP when an enemy is defeated.
Avenger Reflects a small amount of received damage.
 
Characters:
Scythe Man:
He lacks human emotion and comes off as a reaper. Hell stand before the protagonist and friends a number of times in order to kill Setsuna
 
Kuon: 
A traveler who visited the town long before Setsuna was chosen as a sacrifice. Is trusted by the people of the town. Shes like an older sister to Setsuna, and feels strongly about going along with the MC on this journey.
 
Yomi: 
A swordsman who once accompanied a previous sacrifice to her place of fate, and succeeded in that mission long before Setsuna was ever chosen. He gives advice to the MC from a place of experience. He likes taking care of others, and accompanies Setsuna on her journey.
 
MISC:
Active Time Battle
 
The Active Time Battle (ATB) system is a common characteristic of Square Enix-developed RPGs. Ikenie to Yuki no Setsunas battle system is based on Chrono Triggers ATB 2.0 battle system. It is a choose your command-based battle system full of tension.
 
When your ATB gauge is filled, you can take action. Also, if several characters ATB gauges are filled, you can select their actions in the order you prefer.
 
Depending on where youre located compared to the enemy, you can deal ranged damage, or damage enemies with the trails of a projectile weapon. By properly devising the timing of your actions, its possible to fight more advantageously
 
(The combat system is based on Chrono Triggers; Battles occur seamlessly when you get close to enemies on the field. When the red bar at the bottom fills up, you can take your turn. Your location on the field is also important in battle. 
 
The Setsuna System:
When the Setsuna Gauge at the bottom fills up in battle, the Setsuna System can be activated by pressing a button in time with the activation of a skill. If you do it properly, your attacks will be super strong versions, with higher damage and lots more craziness going on. For example, you might regain HP with every attack.
The combat system is based on Chrono Triggers, and is currently being called ATB Ver. 2. Battles occur seamlessly when you get close to enemies on the field. When the red bar at the bottom fills up, you can take your turn. Your location on the field is also important in battle. 
 
The Setsuna System: When the Setsuna Gauge at the bottom fills up in battle, the Setsuna System can be activated by pressing a button in time with the activation of a skill. If you do it properly, your attacks will be super strong versions, with higher damage and lots more craziness going on. For example, you might regain HP with every attack.

posts.content:
MÃ¡s detalles y capturas de Heroes II:

 


Cita: Prologue


On the day the dragon eats the sun, the twins will be born, and the land will be covered in war once again.


The setting of Dragon Quest Heroes IIs story is seven kingdoms that have seen continued peace over a long period. However, that balance suddenyl crumbles one day, and war breaks out. Its as if the events are following an ominous prophecy handed down from ancient times


Razel, who is studying at the military academy in Orenka, and Tereshia, who comes to Orenka wanting to visit Razel, in the wake of the battle between their homeland of Gywall and Orenka, get caught up in the giant battle that covers the world.


Can the heroes stop a giant war involving seven countries?


Large armies of monsters square off against each other, and the battle finally began.





What could have caused the collapse of the seven kingdoms balance, which was once at peace?

Akira Toriyama-designed Characters


The protagonists of this work are Razel, who is studying abroad at a military academy in Orenka, and his cousin Tereshia. Just like Dragon Quest Heroes: The World Trees Woe and the Blight Below, you can select between either protagonist and the story will follow their point of view. The protagonists and their friends were designed by Akira Toriyama.

Razel (Male Protagonist)



A proud novice knight. A military cadet in Gywall studying abroad at neighboring country Orenkas military academy. He is a passionate guy who is always energetically racing ahead. He fights wielding dual blades.

Tereshia (Female Protagonist)



A fighting female class president. A military cadet in Gywall and Razels cousin. She provides some levelheadedness to balance Razels tendency to race ahead.

Cesare



A prince and commander-in-chief of the army. The Prince of Gywall and childhood friend of the protagonists. He is adored for his personality, but unmanageable when he loses his temper.

Orneze



The dependable big sister-type to the protagonists. A warrior who serves King Zebion. She is famous as the red female warrior who uses a giant ax. She is cheerful and reliable.

1,000 Years of Peace and Harmony



In the suzerain state of Zebion, seven kingdoms prospered, living in 1,000 years of peace and harmony. Its locales range from deserts to snowy fields and so on.

Zebion



The suzerain state of Zebion that governs the countries of the world is a flourishing country that gathers people from all around the world. As the red female warrior who serves King Zebion, Orenzes name is well-known here.

King Zebion was also designed by Akira Toriyama:



The Countries Where Humans and Monsters Live
  • Orenka Orenka is famous for its lively harbor and beautiful ancient prophecy stained glass cathedral. Military cadet Razel is studying abroad in Orenka at the military academy.

  • Gywall Gywall is the desert home country of the protagonists. Gywall has friendly relations with Orenka, but something happens. Cesare is prince of this country.

  • Kretia Kretia ruled by a historic magician family. Magicians from all over the world gather in this country prosperous in the study of magic.

The Countries Where Monsters Reign

Mohrias, Felnock, and Daral are the three countries known collectively as Monsterlea, built on the frontier and where monsters live. Each of these countries is ruled by a monster king. There are vast snowfields in the southwest, where the Sacred Mountain Rehgan rises.

Gematsu

Tracking Board: Lionsgate is Working on Naruto Movie

Michael Gracey in talks to direct

 

Hollywood news website The Tracking Board reported on Thursday that Lionsgate has closed the rights to adapt Masashi Kishimoto's Naruto manga into a film.

 

Lionsgate is in talks with Michael Gracey to direct. Gracey has previously worked in visual effects and animation, and is now directing several upcoming films, such as an adaptation of Roald Dahl's The Witches and an Elton John biopic Rocketman.

 

Avi Arad (Hollywood's Ghost in the Shell, Gamba: Gamba to Nakama-tachi) is producing the film at Arad Productions, and Erik Feig, Geoff Shaveitz and Kelly O'Malley are overseeing the film.

posts.content:
The Last: Naruto The Movie to Play in U.S. Theaters

 

 





In NYC, Boston, Houston, Dallas, L.A., S.D., S.F., Seattle, other cities starting February 20


North American anime distributor Viz Media announced on Friday that it is collaborating with film distributor Eleven Arts to releaseThe Last -Naruto the Movie- in theaters in the United States. The English-subtitled theatrical run will begin on February 20, and it will "initially screen in 20 major U.S. cities including New York, Boston, Houston, Dallas, Los Angeles, San Diego, San Francisco, Seattle, and more."


Tickets will go on sale in mid-January. While supplies last, attendees will receive a special commemorative Naruto film poster.


Weekly Shonen Jump and Jump J Books describe the story of the movie and its novelization:


 


The film debuted in Japan on December 6 as the first Naruto film in two years. Madman Entertainmentwill open the film in cinemas in Australia and New Zealand on January 17.The moon has begun moving closer to Earth! As it is, the moon will crumble and meteorites will rain down on Earth's surface. As the last days of Earth approach, Hanabi Hyga is abducted by a mysterious man in Konoha, and Naruto, Sakura, Sai, Shikamaru, and Hinata set off on a rescue mission! Can Naruto and the others overcome this crisis?


 


Manga creator Masashi Kishimoto is credited with the original story, character designs, and chief story supervisor of the film. In particular, he drew new designs for the title character in the movie, as well as for other characters. Tsuneo Kobayashi (The Twelve Kingdoms, Emma: A Victorian Romance,Kurokami The Animation) directed the film, and Sukima Switch contributed the main theme song as well as voice-acting ninja.


Kishimoto announced more details on next August's new Naruto movie during a stage greeting at a Tokyo screening of The Last -Naruto the Movie- earlier this month. He is serving as chief production supervisor for next year's movie.


The Last -Naruto the Movie- is part of the larger "Naruto Shin Jidai Kaimaku Project" (Naruto's New Era Opening Project) marking the 15th anniversary of the original manga. The Naruto manga by Masashi Kishimoto ended in Shueisha's Weekly Shonen Jump magazine on November 10 after 15 years of serialization. A ne mini-series by Kishimoto with "a newly budding Konoha story" will launch next spring. An art exhibition and a stage play will also debut next spring.


 


Fuente: Anime News Network

Masashi Kishimoto habla sobre su experiencia al terminar Naruto


 


Siendo una de las noticias mÃ¡s destacadas de la semana, el periÃ³dico japonÃ©s Asahi Shinbun ha entrevistado al dibujante Masashi Kishimoto con motivo de la reciente finalizaciÃ³n de su obra mÃ¡s famosa: Naruto. El artista ha declarado que suele trabajar en su habitaciÃ³n, asÃ­ que no tenÃ­a ni idea de que su manga era tan popular en el extranjero hasta que empezÃ³ a recibir muchas cartas de fans en distintos idiomas. En concreto, parece ser que le hace muy feliz recibir cartas con fotos y dibujos, como una que contenÃ­a la fotografÃ­a de un niÃ±o vestido como el propio Naruto. AsÃ­ mismo, Kishimoto afirma que ya tenÃ­a pensada la batalla entre Naruto y Sasuke desde que empezÃ³ la historia, pero que fue decidiendo los detalles poco a poco, como si lucharÃ­an como amigos o como enemigos, y tambiÃ©n sus sentimientos y palabras en ese momento. Por otro lado, parece ser que no esperaba en absoluto que la serie fuera a durar 15 largos aÃ±os: segÃºn dice, su editor esperaba que la terminara en el margen de unos cinco aÃ±os, pero Ã©l no podÃ­a acabar la historia tan pronto porque los personajes no se lo permitÃ­an. Si les hubiera hecho actuar como yo querÃ­a, se habrÃ­a perdido la sensaciÃ³n de realidad. Kishimoto habÃ­a terminado de dibujar el Ãºltimo capÃ­tulo apenas 12 horas antes de la entrevista en cuestiÃ³n, asÃ­ que todavÃ­a no se podÃ­a creer que el manga hubiese terminado. He estado cumpliendo fechas de entrega todas las semanas desde hace 15 aÃ±os, asÃ­ que todavÃ­a tengo la impresiÃ³n de que la semana que viene habrÃ¡ una nueva fecha lÃ­mite. Al preguntarle sobre el manga One Piece de Eiichiro Oda, el autor comenta One Piece siempre ha estado corriendo en cabeza, si he podido trabajar tan duro con Naruto es gracias a ella. En cuanto al periplo de Naruto para convertirse en Hokage, el autor comenta que se parece mucho al suyo propio para convertirse en dibujante profesional. Antes se me daban mal los estudios y eso me hizo sentir una gran sensaciÃ³n de inferioridad. Cuando Naruto decÃ­a Voy a convertirme en Hokage la gente se reÃ­a de su sueÃ±o. Yo tambiÃ©n les decÃ­a a los demÃ¡s que algÃºn dÃ­a serÃ­a dibujante, pero no tenÃ­a ninguna base para estar seguro de que serÃ­a asÃ­. Pese a su sentimiento de inferioridad, Kishimoto ha sido capaz de crear una serie increÃ­blemente popular, algo impensable para Ã©l cuando entrÃ³ en el mundo del manga en 1996 con su historia corta Karakuri. La historieta ganÃ³ el premio Hop, Step, Jump de Shueisha, pero el artista decidiÃ³ que todavÃ­a debÃ­a refinar mÃ¡s sus habilidades y durante dos aÃ±os estuvo estudiando cÃ³mo realizar guiones y diÃ¡logos antes de debutar oficialmente con Naruto. Reflexionando sobre el rumbo que ha tomado su obra, Kishimoto cree que ha creado algo nuevo con el enfoque sobre los conflictos que ofrece la historia, ya que el protagonista no siempre decide derrotar a sus enemigos con la fuerza bruta. Los mangas shonen no pueden evitar tener escenas de acciÃ³n, pero yo querÃ­a explicarles a los lectores que los enemigos que recurren a la violencia lo hacen porque seguramente no tienen otra alternativa. Por tanto, si los protagonistas les derrotan sin comprender sus motivaciones, eso terminarÃ¡ llevando a que todo se repita de nuevo. Aunque cumpliÃ³ los 40 aÃ±os el pasado sÃ¡bado, dice que no ha cambiado nada desde que empezÃ³ a dibujar cuando tenÃ­a 25. TodavÃ­a no sabe cuÃ¡l serÃ¡ su prÃ³ximo proyecto, pero promete a los lectores que seguirÃ¡ dibujando manga.
